alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Franklin; Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 19 at 6:22AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest and western Maine, including the following counties, in southwest Maine, Cumberland. In western Maine, Franklin and Oxford. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 619 AM EDT, Observers have reported 1 to 3 inches of rain have fallen over the warned area in the last 12 hours. Though the rain is lifting out of the area, runoff will continue through the morning hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, Farmington, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Bethel, Eustis, Rumford, Rangeley, Naples and Jay.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
